climbs.name: School Bus
climbs.fa: Curtis Vinson, Vaino Kodas, Chris Morath, 2006

content.description: This is the second from the right climb on Schoolhouse Slab. Very similar to its neighboring climbs. [Admin note - 10/21/2021] This route was originally named "Short Bus" but renamed by the MP admin Jason Halladay to "School Bus" on account of inclusivity.

climbs.name: Que?
climbs.fa: Unknown. Bolted for lead climbing, May 2008

content.description:
Climb the center of Schoolhouse Slab, moving upward on cobbles of all shapes and sizes.  Seemed hardest about 12' up, and again after the last bolt. 

  This climb is listed as a "Toprope" in 'Taos Rock', but has now been recently bolted so now it's another fun and safe lead for beginner leaders on Schoolhouse Slab.
content.location: This is 2nd from the left climb on Schoolhouse Slab (between Cobb It and Herby Goes Bananas (aka School Daze)).  You can set a toprope on this by traversing over from one of the adjacent lines.

climbs.name: Herby Goes Bananas (aka School Daze)
climbs.fa: Alisa Green and Walt Wehner, 1997 or so

content.description: Of the bolted routes on this crag, this is the one that is second one from the right. Follow the bolts up mellow climbing with large foot and hand holds.
content.location: Route second from the right on the crag.

climbs.name: Cobb It
climbs.fa: Alisa Green and Walt Wehner, 1997 or so

content.description: Very similar to Herby Goes Bananas (aka School Daze), but a little more difficult.  The holds seamed to be a little more solid as well.  Fun initial moves lead past three bolts to the anchors.  Good warm up route.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: First climb on Schoolhouse Slab when approaching from the chockstone, left-most climb on the crag.  There is a 5.7 Que? just to the right.

climbs.name: Bolting Barney
climbs.fa: Jason Halladay, Ryan Kalas, Allison Fritz

content.description: Similar in nature to the routes to the left but shorter with an easier finish. Climb pockets up to a small ledge and the anchors just under the tree branches. Certainly nothing to write home about but hopefully will spread out the traffic  on this busy wall.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor with lowering biners
content.location: Furthest right route on the wall. Finish under the tree branches.

content.description: One of two crags that faces south (the other is Super Slab), making it a nice morning crag for those colder days. A nice area for beginners to practice leading, or climbing, or just a place to stay warm. Crag has five 5.7s on it, listed from left to right.
